noun.description: A member of an indigenous people of eastern Siberia.
The language of the Even, a Tungusic language with about 6,000 speakers, closely related to Evenki.

adjective.description: Relating to the Even or their language.

examples: she cut the hair again to even up the ends

adverb.description: Used to emphasize something surprising or extreme.
examples: they have never even heard of the US
they wore fur hats, even in summer

phrases: even as he spoke their baggage was being unloaded
It is a solid part of that India that moves on, even as it falls apart, or lags behind.
Williamson, even as an outsider, always felt the Edinburgh derby was a major fixture.
These things combined together to give me a new sense of awkwardness, even as I left the old one behind.
He thinks through every question I ask, even as he fidgets and flexes constantly in his chair.
origin: Old English ǣfen, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch avont and German Abend.
